content: yarn used sirdar country style 4ply 3x50gram balls shade 0540 needle uk3 75mm/us5 120cm circular notions tapestry needle 3 lockable markers gauge 20sts-36rows-10cms blocked garter stitch finished measurements after blocking wingspan-148cms width at widest point-130cms abbreviations k knit p purl rs right side ws wrong side pm place marker slm slip marker m marker yo yarn over kfb knit into front and back of next stitch one stitch increased kfbf knit into front back and front of next stitch two stitches increased instructions garter tab cast on using 3 75mm needle cast on 3sts place a lockable marker onto each stitch and knit 7rows turn piece 90 degrees and pick up and knit 3sts along edge of work pick up and knit the 3sts from the lockable markers and remove the markers 9sts set up row k4 pm p1 pm k4 section one row 1 rs k3 yo knit to m yo slm k1 slm yo knit to last 3sts yo k3 row 2 ws k3 yo knit to m slm p1 slm knit to last 3sts yo k3 work row 1 and 2 for a total of 70 row 219sts section two row 1 rs k3 yo knit to m yo slm k1 slm yo knit to last 3sts yo k3 row 2 ws knit to m slm p1 slm knit to end work row 1 and 2 for a total of 50 row 319sts next row rs *kfb repeat from * to 4sts before m kfbf nine times removing markers *kfb repeat from * to end 647sts next row knit work last row until almost all of the yarn is used leaving enough to cast off approximately 16 row cast off loosely and weave in all ends wash garment following instructions on ball band and lay out flat to dry pinning to finished measurements © copyright 2025 brian smith all rights reserved for personal use only
